title: Get Media Buys Request
description: Request parameters for retrieving media buy status, creative approval state, and optional delivery snapshots

account.title: Account Reference
account.description: Account to retrieve media buys for.

account_id.description: Seller-assigned account identifier (from sync_accounts or list_accounts)

domain.description: Domain where /.well-known/brand.json is hosted, or the brand's operating domain

brand_id.title: Brand ID
brand_id.description: Brand identifier within the house portfolio. Optional for single-brand domains.

operator.description: Domain of the entity operating on the brand's behalf. When the brand operates directly, this is the brand's domain.

media_buy_ids.description: Array of publisher media buy IDs to retrieve. When omitted along with buyer_refs, returns a paginated set of accessible media buys matching status_filter.

buyer_refs.description: Array of buyer reference IDs to retrieve

enumDescriptions.pending_activation: Media buy created but not yet activated
Media buy created but not yet activated

status_filter.description: Filter by status. Can be a single status or array of statuses. Defaults to ["active"] only when media_buy_ids and buyer_refs are both omitted. When media_buy_ids or buyer_refs are provided, no implicit status filter is applied.

include_snapshot.description: When true, include a near-real-time delivery snapshot for each package. Snapshots reflect the latest available entity-level stats from the platform (e.g., updated every ~15 minutes on GAM, ~1 hour on batch-only platforms). The staleness_seconds field on each snapshot indicates data freshness. If a snapshot cannot be returned, package.snapshot_unavailable_reason explains why. Defaults to false.

pagination.title: Pagination Request
pagination.description: Cursor-based pagination controls. Strongly recommended when querying broad scopes (for example, all active media buys in an account).

max_results.description: Maximum number of items to return per page

cursor.description: Opaque cursor from a previous response to fetch the next page

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
